p: The coronaviruses are single-stranded RNA viruses, with great capacity for fast mutations and recombination, causing respiratory or intestinal infections in humans and animals [ 2]. The SARS-CoV-2 infection occurs through the coupling of S-protein located on the surface of the virus with angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which acts as a receptor for the virus. ACE2 is mostly present in the lungs and seems to be the main gateway for the virus. It is also present in great amounts in the heart, which can lead to cardiovascularÂ (CV) complications [ 2].
